result.execSummary:
The defendant George W Given was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.
Consecutive to: 15CM1005 and 15CM1009.
If after 12 months the deft has completed everything and the agent approves, the Court may be petitioned for early termination of probation.

miscConds.notes: Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including anger management, and a mental health examination. No violent or criminal contact with the Sheriff's department, DA's office or the victim. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
